title: Lost Lettermen
text:
Lost Lettermen was a sports <a href="weblog">weblog</a> and <a href="database">database</a>, which was launched by Jim Weber in March 2009. It was dedicated to former college <a href="American%20football">football</a> and <a href="basketball">basketball</a> players. It regularly interviewed former college stars such as <a href="Tee%20Martin">Tee Martin</a>, <a href="Charlie%20Ward">Charlie Ward</a>, <a href="Ki-Jana%20Carter">Ki-Jana Carter</a>, <a href="Ed%20O%27Bannon">Ed O'Bannon</a>, <a href="Corliss%20Williamson">Corliss Williamson</a> and <a href="Mateen%20Cleaves">Mateen Cleaves</a>. It also had a database of over 150,000 former college athletes to answer the question, "Where Are They Now?"
The site was featured in "<a href="USA%20Today">USA Today</a>" in March 2010 to locate the current whereabouts of <a href="NCAA%20Men%27s%20Division%20I%20Basketball%20Championship">NCAA Tournament</a> one-hit wonders such as <a href="Bryce%20Drew">Bryce Drew</a> and <a href="Kevin%20Pittsnogle">Kevin Pittsnogle</a>.
Jim Weber sold the site in 2015, and as of August 2017 it no longer was in operation.
